Detailed Description

Class to hold spectrum data.

This class should hold all the data (spectrum, location, concentration, calibration information) for a spectrum

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum CSpectrumData::SerializeModes

Define output style of serialize.

If used with outputCSV, the data header (horizontal) and the acutal data (vertical) can be generated separately

Enumerator:
outputCSV 
outputXML

void CSpectrumData::PaintReport ( CDC *  pDC,
CPrintInfo *  pInfo,
LPRECT  myrect 
)

Create a (print) report.

The report contains

a header with all the relevant text data, an optional logo to be printed in the header the spectrum itself a calibration curve based on the data contained in the spectrum

bool CSpectrumData::PaintSpectrum ( CDC *  pDC,
LPRECT  myrect,
CPen *  pen,
double  wmin,
double  wmax,
double  imin,
double  imax,
bool  redraw_axis,
bool  wavlen_line 
)

Draw the spectrum.

Parameters:
pDC - pointer to drawing canvas
myrect - dimensions of whole canvas (what are the boundary conditions?)
pen - line color of spectrum
wmin - minimum wavelength of spectrum
wmax - maximum wavelength of spectrum
imin - minimum intensity / count value of spectrum
imax - maximum intensity / count value of spectrum
redraw_axis - allow suppressing axis drawing if we are painting multiple spectra
bool CSpectrumData::PaintSpectrum ( CDC *  pDC,
LPRECT  myrect,
CPen *  pen,
bool  wavlen_line 
) [inline]

Draw only a single spectrum.

This is a wrapper to use if only a single spectrum is needed and there is no need to pass extra limit information or to suppress the redrawing of axes

int CSpectrumData::calType [private]

Calibration type to go with concentration.

Currently defined values are: 0 - none/undefined 2 - linear 3 - square 4 - cubic
